snippet: Over the last decade Judge Shira A. Scheindlin has presided over many cases involving the Police Department’s stop-and-frisk policies — a development that has frustrated city officials.
abstract: Judge Shira A Scheindlin, who presided over 1999 police brutality case involving Guinean immigrant Amadou Diallo, has come to exercise near exclusive jurisdiction in deciding stop-and-frisk cases involving New York Police Department; Scheindlin's dominance over issue has frustrated some city officials, and Police Commissioner Raymond W Kelly has accused her of bias in favor of civil rights groups.
lead_paragraph: Over the last decade Judge Shira A. Scheindlin has presided over many cases involving the Police Department’s stop-and-frisk policies — a development that has frustrated city officials.

headline.seo: A Court Rule Directs Cases Over Friskings to One Judge
headline.main: A Court Rule Directs Cases Over Friskings to One Judge
headline.print_headline: A Court Rule Directs Cases Over Friskings To One Judge
